ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We made them a thing of the past, an example for later peoples.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And made them a precedent and example for posterity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and made them a thing of the past and an example for those who would come after them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We made them become of the people of the past and an example for the coming generations.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So We made them a bygone fable and a lesson for the latter generations.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And We made them a precedent, and an example to later generations.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And We made them a precedent and example to the later generations.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and We made them a thing past, and We appointed them for an example to later folk.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And We made them a thing past, and an example for those after (them).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We made them a precedent, an example for later peoples.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And We made them a precedent and an ensample Unto those after.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Thus We made them the vanguard and an example for posterity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And We made them (a people) of the Past and an Example to later ages.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And We made them a precedent (as a lesson for those coming after them), and an example to later generations.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and We made them a thing of the past, and We made them an example to later people.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Thus We made them a precedent and an example for the others.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And We made them a precedent and an example for the later peoples.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [43:56] And We made them a thing past (salaf, is the plural of sālif, similar [in pattern] to khādim, khadam) that is to say, a precedent, as a lesson, and an example for others, after them, that they [posterity] might take their predicament as a lesson and so not engage in actions similar to theirs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And We made them a thing past) by means of the punishment, (and an example) and a lesson (for those after (them)) for those who remained after them.
